alert.note: Alert for Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 3:56PM EST until January 14 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Essex County in northeastern Massachusetts... East central Worcester County in central Massachusetts... Northwestern Norfolk County in eastern Massachusetts... Central Middlesex County in northeastern Massachusetts... * Until 445 PM EST. * At 355 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Dracut to Boylston, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Lowell, Lawrence, Framingham, Haverhill, Waltham, Methuen, Arlington, Billerica, Marlborough, Woburn, Shrewsbury, Chelmsford, Andover, Natick, Lexington, Dracut, Tewksbury, North Andover, and Wellesley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
